reviews.review_msg: Known as one of the best CS profs at SFU, and I can see why. Marking is very fair, and assignments are relevant to the course content, although can be a little time consuming. Overall, a solid choice!
Arguably one of the goats.

Lectures are clear also recorded, so don't need other learning materials. This is a big time saving!
Homework isn't difficult as he provides step-by-step pesudocode.
Exams include about 20% difficult questions, but you can easily get the rest by following his lectures and doing slight review before exams.
He answers our questions in Piazza quickly.
best candidate for this course

Dr. Alameldeen excels in clear, organized lectures and makes complex subjects accessible. Known for his approachability, he quickly responds to inquiries, enhancing learning. Highly recommend his classes for a rewarding experience. Early review course material and basic C++ knowledge help with assignments.

Probably one of the best profs I have had at SFU. He's the only prof I've had where I feel 100% comfortable asking for clarification on anything because he will happily re-explain if necessary. He is also very accessible outside of class and will answer any question you have. Exams are difficult but very fair. Wish he taught more courses :')

Course itself and assignments are pretty good, but not a fan of his lecture. He just reads off slides which are ~100% based on textbooks so lectures are basically skippable. Open book quizzes and no final.
The man, the myth, the legend! He is so caring and willing to review the material again to ensure we understand it.

Seriously, 5/5 is not an understatement. He cares so much. A whole week before finals, he was answering 10s of piazza questions each day in under 30 minutes (night and day,literally). If he notices the class isn't following him, he is not hesitant to explain everything again even more slowly, yet with the same friendliness and enthusiasm.
Better than Arrvindh

Goated prof. Answers all questions clearly and very accessible outside of class for help on material and assignments via piazza. Lectures can be a little dry due to the nature of the material going over formulas and their derivation. 4 tests, one every 3 weeks but open book/internet and pretty straight forward if you generally know all the content
Top G of a professor, he's probably the only good prof we have in the cs department. If we taught more classes I would take them.

Having Alaa with Arrvindh was an experience. Its like you dip your body in hot water and then you get the relief of getting your body cooled down with fresh mineral spring water from the swiss alps. With Arrvindh being the hot water and Alaa the cool water.

Alaa Cares a lot, he stays up late to answer questions and is generally quite nice.

Alaa is one of the realest, most caring professors around the block. The content in 295 is not easy and Alaa is the reason why I made it through. He is always very patient with all of us and will do anything to help us understand the material! I, myself, might even call him the GOAT alongside Michael Jordan and Lebron James.

* THIS IS FOR CMPT 450 BUT IT'S NOT AN OPTION AND I CAN'T ADD IT.

"Caring" wouldn't describe how much he is always willing to help and how much he prioritizes students. Always accessible & understanding and super knowledgeable about the subject. He's the best professor I've taken a course with at SFU. He stays up till 2AM answering questions!!
The Goat actually cares about your success and will work overtime to help you
The GOAT.

Alaa made a good effort at explaining material although gets monotone and fails at emphasizing what is important. 

Very responsive to student questions

Alaa is one of the most considerate professors ever! He actually cares about his students and will patiently respond to all of our questions. His exams are quite fair and he is very lenient with his grading.CMPT295 is a pretty tough course imo and Alaa made it a lot easier to get through. Will take again.

This course is usually split in half. First half is done with a different prof , latter half is done with this prof. This professor does seem to care about the student. During the finals season, he was even seen staying awake till 2 AM to answer questions.
Great professor all around. This guy truly cares and will go out of his way to assist you. Definitely would recommend taking courses with him.
Great prof that really cares about his students, very open and responsive to questions

He's humane and genuinely cares about his student's well-being. The last half of the material was difficult, however, he made sure that you understood it if you asked questions. Madlad stayed up super late just to answer Piazza questions about the practice finals. He's a bit monotone during lectures, but other than that, he's a respectable guy!

431 with Alaa was really fun. Assignments were reasonable and interesting and if you're into distributed systems he's definitely very knowledgeable on the topic in a non-condescending way conducive to learning. Awesome professor.
Very knowledgeable and looks out for students falling behind. Takes the extra steps to help during class and in off-hours. Really appreciate it!

Professor Alaa is very knowledgeable and knows his material super well. Very organized. There are 4 exams, so the load is quite high. Assignments are not as easy as others say since I am not too comfortable with c++. But he answered your questions promptly, that made it a bit easier for me. It would never go wrong taking any of his classes I think.

I really enjoyed Alaa's teaching style. His lectures were really succinct and straightfoward. The assignments were really easy and straightfoward if you are comfortable with C/C++ and thread stuff from CMPT 300. Also very accessible and respectful learning environment and timely answers. Could not recommend this prof more.
Useful concepts and kind professor! There are 8 assignments and are based on C++. You will have a hard time if you feel uncomfortable with writing C/C++ stuff.

An excellent professor that genuinely cares about his students. Held additional office hours on a holiday. Responded to an e-mail at 1 am in the morning. He's also extremely knowledgeable -- I don't recall a question he couldn't answer in depth. His quizzes are extremely easy for a 300 level course. Our class average was A-

Good prof, very responsive to questions, good lectures, useful slides, and lots of examples. Quizzes are not too bad, assignments were mostly reasonable, but having 2 group projects at the end of the term made it quite miserable to complete when you have 3 finals to study for. Tough class and prof but you learn a lot from him!
